website_summaries.verdict: Kong Extreme is the pinnacle of hardcore chew toys for the strongest and most determined chewers out there.
pros: Available in sizes small through XXL
Other Kong Extreme toy shapes are available
Bouncy, hollow center for inserting treats or peanut butter
cons: If your “dog” can break this, it may actually be a werewolf

customer_reviews.title: Best toy I have found
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the best toy I have found, our dog goes through it in about a month, but any other toys he destroys in about 20 min, we have a 90lb American Staffordshire terrier and the size XL works best, the XXL didn't last as long because he can get his mouth inside it better to tear it apart.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Possible Fake. Split in half after a couple uses.
customer_reviews.text: Along with the other 1-star reviewers, this KONG is garbage. I bought a larger red Kong from a local store and lasts my "brass teeth" lab months. This Kong didn't even last 10 uses! Either the "Extreme" Kongs are poor design OR these (like many other things on Amazon) are knockoffs that nobody caught yet. I'm tempted to buy this exact one on the local store to rule out fraudulent Amazon purchase. Amazon Customer Service, coming from someone that relies solely on you for many of my purchases, it is important to trust you. Please do an audit (not only the Kong) and get rid of the fakes!
customer_reviews.author: TechCraver

customer_reviews.title: Pit Mix 1 - Kong Extreme 0 - FT 10 mins
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 10 minutes with my 50 lb. Pit mix. This was the Large, going to try the XL, if that fails the XXL and if that fails just give her iron bars to chew on! The hunt for a chew toy that lasts longer than 10 minutes continues...
customer_reviews.author: SIMON PATERSON

customer_reviews.title: Black is not XLARGE, it’s Med-Lrg.
customer_reviews.text: I love KONG products. I’ve purchased before but never on Amazon. Usually at my local pet store is where I pick up my KONG products. I wanted an extra one the same size as I’ve purchase in the past. The listing said it was XLarge so I went ahead and purchased. When I received it it was medium-large size?, which my dogs don’t mind. And, why I decided not to refund it. But, for the purpose of other Prime members purchasing based merely on reviews, I wanted to leave some feedback. I’ve attached a photo of my XLarge KONG Red next to the XLarge KONG Blk.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan F.

customer_reviews.title: not so extreme, don't purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these "extreme" Kongs for my 6 month old Boston Terrier. I have had items from the extreme line for my small Pit Bull and they have held up for over 2 years. However, my Boston had the first toy from this package for 15 minutes and he had the top off of the toy. His teeth are TINY (he is only 14 pounds)! There is no way this product was an authentic Kong. Do NOT purchase from this seller, go to PetSmart and get an authentic item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dog toy but get a size up!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy, it really holds up to strong chewing. It keeps my dogs entertained for a long time when it is stuffed and frozen. The XXL is a good size for my 1 year old 85 pound German Shepherd. The "Large" is good for my 25 pound ACD mix. The only negative thing about the largest size is the hole is pretty big so it is hard to find treats big enough to stay in there, that is why I usually use peanut butter or wet dog food and freeze it. Spend a little bit more for the black version of the Kong and it's worth it in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Kate TTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I misread regarding the size of this Kong, but it was described as "large", but when it came yesterday, it was very small! My 9 month old lab can almost fit the whole thing in her mouth. Still, I was willing to see if it was something she could chew and play with. After literally 30 MINUTES the Kong had torn at the top! This was labeled as an Extreme Kong! Not acceptable! I tried to set up a return this morning, and of course, it says this item is not eligible for returns, so that was a big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: idmommy97

customer_reviews.title: Substantially lesser quality than previous versions
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten both red and the black Extreme Kongs before and have been very happy with both. Unfortunately, this medium Extreme version didn't come close to the quality of my proir purchases. This was demolished by my moderate-chewer lab puppy in less than an hour. :( Does not match the advertised strength AT ALL. Hoping that it was a fluke and we'll get a replacement that holds up since nothing else has lasted with our 3 year old lab-hound aggressive chewer, but from other reviews I'm doubtful. :-/
customer_reviews.author: TRNeuTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not for tough chewers - waste of time
customer_reviews.text: My 65lb, 15mo Bully mix had this toy for 15minutes!!! It did not hold up nor meet its claim of being 85+lb dogs or power chewers. I am highly disappointed in Kong Extreme products. I tried the Kong Extreme XL, XXL and the Extreme Ball. Good thing they have a 30 day money back guarantee! Westpaw tough chews are no better, but also have a one time replacement guarantee. Goughnuts is 3x the cost, but has held up for over a week so far and still going strong - and they too have a (lifetime) replacement guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: LBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: filled with peanut butter and frozen will lead to doggy bliss
customer_reviews.text: my dog LOVES this...probably more because I fill it with peanut butter and freeze it. I've got a german shepherd pup who's almost 9 months and has been known to chew through toys if you let him go too long. Well, I bought this to keep him occupied and frozen peanut butter does the trick. He takes it and sits in his kennel and you couldn't find a happier dog on the planet.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: Would probably be loved by dog if it didn't stink.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived finally. Opened the bag and the smell was terrible. Both dogs snorted and walked away. How do you get rid of the smell? I had a Kong yrs ago for a different dog and it never smelled like this. I washed in warm soap and water twice hoping to reduce. Nope. Now I have smeared peanut butter all over it. Still stinks. I guess that qualifies as chew proof as the dogs won't touch it. I give it as good a rating as I can as I know that the last one I had was loved by my dog. Its a Kong, quality is still there.
customer_reviews.author: tibet

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Smell
customer_reviews.text: We always use Kongs for our dogs when we leave them for an extended period of time. After a while they start to break down and we have to replace them. For some reason, this Kong, though it looked like previous ones (except it was black instead of red), smelled terrible - like strong chemicals. I washed it several times, and it still reeked. I wouldn't put any food (peanut butter or cheese) into it - as I was concerned for the dogs' safety, plus with the smell, we got rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Good for anxious dogs; fill with peanut butter for guaranteed peace
customer_reviews.text: Working well with my insane little Jack Russell terrier mix. Her great joy was to chew on the regular strength kongs until destroying them over the years. Hasn't destroyed the 2 x-small extreme kongs. I am optimistic these will last; good for filling with peanut butter. Very entertaining for my dogs if I fill with peanut butter; keeps them busy for 1-2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Chez Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Pretty stout
customer_reviews.text: My new little dog is a chewing machine. 50 pounds of destruction. She has destroyed every toy we've tried with her (and eaten entirely too much of them--not to mention one of my shoes!), even other Kong toys. So far, and I'm cautiously optimistic here, she has not managed to rip off any chunks of this Extreme toy. And she does like to play with it. Only downside is the color. Since it's black, it's easy to lose track of in dark corners. It was lost for a few days, so I ordered another in self defense. So far, so good. If she does manage to rip off chunks, I'll be back to let you know!
customer_reviews.author: Shadow Flower

customer_reviews.title: Durable for MOST heavy chewers
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my boyfriend's dog and I already had one for mine (mine lives with my parents, boyfriend's lives with us). My boyfriend's dog absolutely loves it. She's an American bulldog, and normally she will chew on things like rawhides or bones until she bleeds, so we got her this because it would be gentler on her mouth while also being durable. I plan to get a few more to rotate them out. If you have a pitbull or a pitbull mix, it probably will not last, as they are typically the heaviest chewers, but for the majority of dogs it's a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Femme

customer_reviews.title: Nope not all that durable
customer_reviews.text: We've gone through several dog chew toys with our now 8 month old black lab puppy. She destroyed this one in less than a day. The only thing that seems to have worked thus far is the largest red "bell" shaped toy. This black one was a medium. Recommend that if you do have a power chewer you get a larger (largest) size. I noticed no difference between the black and red versions regarding durability, but size does seem to matter in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a hair too big but holds up
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and holds up; I have powerful chewers. I have two dogs, both have trouble getting stuff down near the bottom so maybe I could have gone down a size even if against recommendation. Both dogs have anxiety issues as they were rescues. One is not a chewer but he likes quick food and gives up quickly when it is frozen. Won't even bother. The other dog Gets frenzied around food so does better with it frozen as she will lick it until the last crumb is gone. Go with your dog's personality when it comes to that. We fill it with various things; apples, bananas, peanut butter, pumpkin purée, oatmeal, dog food, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M.

customer_reviews.title: An iconic dog toy that mostly meets the hype.
customer_reviews.text: One of the most durable dog toys you can buy. Even so, it has some flaws. If you really have a destructive chewer, make sure you get the big one. The smaller ones are way to easy to rip off. We ordered the medium and our dog has ripped off the top (smallest) section. Admittedly it took her a couple months, so I’m not complaining. She still hasn’t, and I’m not sure she will, done much damage to the lower two sections. It’s a bit awkward to throw, but sometimes makes it extra entertaining for the dog. Additionally, the ability to hide things inside it is useful for distracting the dog for 10-30mins depending on what you place in there.
customer_reviews.author: Man of Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Size up! Much smaller than previous Kongs of same "size" that I have purchased
customer_reviews.text: this is my 5th Extreme Kong large size that I purchase. When I went to use it, it was much smaller than all the others I have. Was too late to return it after I had thrown out the packaging so now have to live with it. Opening is very small making stuffing it a bit of a task. It is a quality product, no doubt but the downsizing of the item renders it too small for my Golden. Stuffing it with wet dog food and freezing is how I use these so whatever size you are looking to buy, I'd recommend sizing up by one.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Never again!! Almost lost my dog 🐶
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t last but half of a second with my pitbull 🤦🏽‍♀️ Trying to figure out if it released a chemical or something because my pocket pit became really ill 🤒 like blood squirting out of her rectum and yellow bile and we found the Kong with white crusty hard powder inside of it so I would never buy another one again!!! Just to be safe I will be calling Amazon and letting them know as well but I just wanted the world to know that it happened to my babygirl and thank goodness she’s ok now but she looked like death!!
customer_reviews.author: Elly

customer_reviews.title: Chew toy
customer_reviews.text: My dog chews through everything, this thing didn't meet my expectations and was wasted money. She only plays with it when I stick food in it, she chews on everything else but this. I dunno why, but she is weird and she is a big dog. Just isn't into it. Wasted money but great for keeping her preoccupied with food stuck in it. Can't speak about durability because she wasn't interested in chewing on it, so she chews on slippers, boxes, bottles, me. It still looks brand new. Oh well
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: Love the durability!
customer_reviews.text: My dog chewed through Kong's signature red one (which is one size down from this one), so I bought this one thinking it'd be thick enough for him to enjoy but not destroy. This one lived up to expectations! It's tough, sturdy, and keeps him thoroughly entertained. I do wish there was a white stripe on it or something though because it blends in quite well with my dark brown hardwood floors - a couple times now I almost rolled my ankle tripping over it because I couldn't see it. That's likely my fault though :)
customer_reviews.author: EmmaRee

customer_reviews.title: Totally well worth the investment!!!
customer_reviews.text: These little treat holders are the greatest thing EV-VER! I have a 3 mos old girl Labradore Retriever & she’s NEVER been this quite since we got her @ 8 wks old. She’s VERY high strung & doesn’t know how to be still. She is even running, jerking & snoring in her sleep, so to see her this interested in something that she can eat/lick or chew on (which is also a natural for Labs up to 2 yrs old) is amazing! I can’t say enough great things about these Kongs & will definitely be recommending family & friends whom don’t have these to get several for their dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: My little yorkie is more toy destructive than my pitt! We'd get him the "tough" toys only to have him chew them up within days. He would find a weak spot and the toy is done for. This thing is the perfect size for him and he loves it. We've had it over a week, that's a record for us!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Holiday

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my power chewer!
customer_reviews.text: Edit because I had to buy a second**** I only bought the second one because the first is missing somewhere in my house! So definitely buy this. My guy uses this every night in his crate and hadn’t even put a dent in it! I’m hoping we find the other one as a back up for this exact scenario. I am very pleased with this product and recommend it 100%!!! I have a weimeriner mix and he is a relentless power chewer. I got this for him to have in his crate and he has not come close to putting a dent in it in the last 3 weeks. I am very pleased with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Does the Dog Like it?
customer_reviews.text: I admit I buy my dog quite a few toys. Every time I've given him one he's always grabbed it and ran off to play with it. I stuffed the Kong with some treats and gave it to him. He spent a couple of minutes working at getting out the treats then walked off. He hasn't come near it sense. It may be a durable toy, but not of much value if the dog's not interested in it. I asked Jerry (my dog) his opinion and this is the rating he came up with.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas Nightmare

customer_reviews.title: Confused
customer_reviews.text: I gave a review praising the thing and it got rejected. As our pups grew so did the size. They love it. Now, tell me what was wrong with that? The only bad thing I want to say is, how rude to reject my review. It was carefully reviewed and then rejected. Guess they didn't see that it said my pups held it in a gold manner or something, have no clue but I won't get anything from these people again and Amazon will be contacted about the rejection.
customer_reviews.author: n/a...

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for only one use
customer_reviews.text: I have a 25 pound mini aussie and I bought this because she chewed right through the regular Kong. This was supposed to be for extreme chewers, which she is not, by any means, and after one use, she had the end chewed off. I won't purchase another Kong like this.
customer_reviews.author: Topaaz

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this thing, even when there's no treats in it he still is gnawing away at it. I got the medium and its about the size of two eggs. (Weird size comparison?) Perfect size for my 5 month old Cocker Spaniel. Its easy to load and to clean too. Definitely stands up to evil razor puppy teeth! Absolutely worth getting for how distracting it is for him when he has to go in his kennel. The only bad thing is if you step on it, its so rigid that it rolls under your foot and you have a small near death experience as you flail to regain your balance. Still alive though, so 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Extreme my butt....
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Kong XL extreme to replace the one my fur baby destroyed. First, the new one was the size of the Large even though it was in an XL package, then within 10 minutes I had chunks of it all over my floor. Completely destroyed. My dog is an 82 lb pitmix. If your dog is an aggressive chewer. I would not recommend ordering from amazon. Maybe if amazon had some quality control this wouldn’t continue to be an issue. But because you run your company like a sweat shop, we don’t get what we paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Boobear356

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend 😍
customer_reviews.text: My 2 dogs Absolutely love this toy! We just got it yesterday. 1 dog 27 lb mutt/rescue and 8 months old German Sheppard/Pitt mix 85lbs. They woke up wanting this toy! I'll have to buy a 2nd one! They also love that there is a treat to get inside. Even without the treat they love it! Very durable even after 1 day I can say that! I'll update as time goes in and try and get a picture if one of them will be still long enough lol
customer_reviews.author: Vampy

customer_reviews.title: Great for nervous fosters and champion chewers alike!
customer_reviews.text: I have two 3 year old 55-lb pitty mixes on my hands right now, one foster and one foster failure. The foster is so skittish, but she LOVES her Kong. So now I have two Kongs, one for my tyrant foster failure who is a jealous resource-guarder, and one for my foster lady to chew in the privacy of another room (so she's not harassed by the foster fail). They're happy when they chew so this is a must-have in our household. I'll be looking into other Kong shapes to provide more chew options (furniture is not my preference)!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa T.

customer_reviews.title: A PLUS!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY! I’ve finally found a toy that my sweet pitbull can’t destroy. We’ve had this thing for months (I was waiting to review) and he has yet to destroy it at all. He loves to chew on it and roll around with it. I also stuff with treats, seal the end with peanut butter, and freeze it for an hour or two before we leave the house for a bit. Seems to really help his anxiety to keep himself occupied. Couldn’t ask for a better toy.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Has something changed?
customer_reviews.text: we have used these for a long time and decided to get some new Kongs since these have lasted years with our aggressive chewers. Unfortunately one of these new Kongs lasted only hours until it started to break apart into chunks. We pay a premium for durable quality, but these are just not quality products. Don't know if it was a defective unit or if Kong has changed their formulation.
customer_reviews.author: R. McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: SUPER SMALL. Not at all meant for a big dog.
customer_reviews.text: This Kong is TINY. It is not at all meant for very large dogs. I was shocked by how small the kong is. We have a German Shepherd and he could easily swallow this Kong if we gave it to him. It is definitely meant for a much smaller dog. I could see giving this to a puppy who is a heavy biter, but definitely not a full-grown large dog.
customer_reviews.author: Movieluver

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well to vigorous use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my young dog that enjoys chewing on occasion. She rips everything up that we give her! Also Baseballs, soccer balls, footballs... Those obviously weren’t meant for her Though. This has been really wonderful. She loves to lick the peanut butter out of it and when she’s being playful we can throw it for her to chase after. It has held up very well. The only thing I don’t like about it is that it’s hard to clean. It takes a good amount of ingenuity to really clean the inside of this product. I worry about bacteria forming inside
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Latrobe

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable Chew Toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Extreme Kong for my very high energy, 10 month old Golden, who has begun to make it his mission to destroy every toy he gets his teeth on, even those labeled "X-tra Tuff". The Vet suggested buying the Black Kong products. Now they are the only chew toys I trust he will not destroy. Filled with squirt cheese or peanut butter and frozen, it keeps my pup a happy camper for awhile, giving me a break. So worth it :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holding up really well after a month
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a month ago for our 80lb Rhodesian Ridgeback, who is a very aggressive chewer and has destroyed every toy he’s ever owned. So far, he hasn’t shredded this one. I paired it with the Kong Ziggies insertable treats, and he spends most of his time licking the toy and trying to figure out how to get the treat. I should also mention our 45lb German Shepherd/pit mix puppy, who is also a demolition machine where toys are concerned, hasn’t been able to put a dent in this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Jones

customer_reviews.title: Overwhelming Chemical Scent
customer_reviews.text: My lab loves his red Kongs, but he's grown and we need a larger size. Ordered these in XL, and the smell was so intense that I didn't feel right giving it to my dog. I washed them, let them air out for a few days but they still had a very strong chemical smell, like gasoline or burnt rubber. My dishwasher smelled like them for two days after I washed them. I expected a rubber scent, as we've bought the red ones in the past. I fill them with a mixture of food, freeze them, and give them to my dog. Didn't feel it was safe to do that, returned them. Guess I'll try ordering the red ones.
customer_reviews.author: NJMOMOF1

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepherd Dog who is now 8 months old. Out of all of the toys and chewers I be gotten her, this was the best purchase I’ve made. It’s held up to her teething. Most importantly, when we were crate training and I wanted to leave without any fuss, I would throw some peanut butter in there for a tasty treat that completely distracts her. She wouldn’t care about my departing and now we use it just for treat time. Otherwise, this is by far my favorite of dog toys and holds my highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Weber

customer_reviews.title: Totally Indestructible!  If MY dog can't kill it, then no dog can!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because our Pit Bull destroys every single toy we buy him. Out of desperation I decided to get him this black Extreme Kong. My wife and I were debating if we'd even get one day out of it. Well, he's been working on this thing for weeks now and hasn't even put a scratch in it and we don't think he ever will. If you have a Monster Dog who chews through everything, the the Extreme Kong is what you need. It's worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: JJB

customer_reviews.title: Finally! A toy for tough chewers.
customer_reviews.text: Finally! A toy that has lasted 1 full month (and still going quite strong). That's a first. Our dog is a chewing fiend! He's around 9 months old and I was becoming convinced that there wasn't a toy out there that could withstand his intense need to chew. It's great for putting peanut butter with kibble/treats into for a little break from the crazy puppy antics. Highly recommend if you've got a serious chewer at home.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiH87

customer_reviews.title: Our pups love playing with this !
customer_reviews.text: Our 10 month old male is an extremely aggressive chewer ! This toy has passed the chew test. It's a nice rubber, it bounces when they hit it just right, and rolls around for their entertainment. I put a little peanutbutter - that is safe for dogs, just inside the rim of the larger opening and our dog spends lots of yummy time trying to lick out the peanutbutter. It's great as it keeps them entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: These are a little tough than the red Kongs. My dog started to get through the normal ones within a month or two. So far, these have lasted much longer. My dog is a pit bull mix and there aren't any major signs of ware and tare on these after two months. Even if your dog isn't a strong chewer, I would recommend this upgrade just because they will last longer, plus, the price different between these and the red ones isn't much.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have a 90lb pitbull/boxer mix and this is the only toy that lasts more than a few days like other chew toys he has tried. My dog enjoys chewing but also enjoys eating what he tears up which is very dangerous! He has a very powerful jaw and needed something that was durable. These usually last him 6-8 weeks before the first signs of damage appear and then we have to give him a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Loveit

customer_reviews.title: The Black Kong Toy May be Very Close to Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Every dog I've ever had has loved its Kong Toy. And while a few have, over the course of many months, managed to chew them up, it has required a concerted effort by some very big and determined dogs. My only caveat is that when you throw it anywhere near the house, its bounce is unpredictable and windows may be destroyed. Dogs love it and that alone makes it a mandatory purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MBT

customer_reviews.title: Good outside toy
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old goldendoodle can destroy pretty much any toy in 10 minutes (even those labeled for "aggressive chewers" but the kong extreme held up well. Sadly, it rolled/bounced under the couch and he went after it...good thing I have an upholstery grade staple gun to repair what got ripped off the bottom of the sofa while trying to retrieve it. Good product, just don't use it where it can get stuck under anything if you aren't around.
customer_reviews.author: TigerLilly

customer_reviews.title: Kong Quality Decreasing?
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this as a replacement for my pup after I accidentally threw his old one over the fence into a green belt of blackberry bushes and was lost forever. That previous Kong was exactly the same and had lasted over a year. This new one I bought lasted 10 days before he ripped the top bulb off, clean off. I don’t know if Kong began manufacturing these differently or if this one was just defective but I’m extremely disappointed in the quality of this most recent one. Money straight down the drain! I’ve always been happy with along as they always have lasted a very long time but now I’m hesitant to spend money on their products.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to a German Shepherd puppy
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write a review because I wanted to see just how well this held up to my German Shepherd puppy -- who can shred anything, just by looking at it (yep, he's that strong). Anyway, I got this during his last month of teething because that's when he tended to want to shred everything in sight. Well, he chewed and chewed on this, but it managed to survive -- Kong 1, Shepherd 0.
customer_reviews.author: Romantic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chew Toy for Hardcore Chewers!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 year old Pitbull that loves his chew toys! And he loves to destroy them too! This is the only chew toy that I have found that he can't destroy in a short period of time! Now don't get me wrong, over time, he is able to slowly chew off small pieces from the top if he works on the same spot for a while! But other chew toys were lucky to make it beyond the first 10 minutes! So this one will last maybe a year but not longer! Next time, I may need to try the XXLarge size!
customer_reviews.author: adensgirl

customer_reviews.title: Kong xxl for your destructo-chewer!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my male golden mix of 68 pounds who is an extra heavy chewer. It lasted about three months with me giving it to him at only a specific time of day. He loves it, when I put the chicken jerky in it and he can tell me just about the same time of day when he wants it! I get tired in the afternoons and it is too hot for him to be outside for any length of time, so we have a schedule for everything. This is a great thing for your heavy chewer!! Viva la Kongs!!!
customer_reviews.author: SCNana

customer_reviews.title: Formula change? Or fake?
customer_reviews.text: Reading the reviews, I have to wonder if all of the black (extreme) Kongs being sold on Amazon are authentic, or if some second party sellers are peddling knock-offs. The Kong we received has a headache-inducing reek - like hot car tires. It is also sticky to the touch and leaves a black, crayon-like smudge if rubbed across paper. I've washed it twice and will let it air out for awhile, but I don't feel confident giving it to my dog as is. Everything about the toy screams "TOXIC!" and it isn't at all like the older, worn-out black Kong it was purchased to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Cinnamon Owl

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: It is far smaller than I anticipated and my Pitt Bull (Jr.) didn’t take an avid interest in it like he does the other toys (which he destroys — even when ‘indestructible’—in record time. It’s sturdy though. My friends Jack Russell dismembered one of these Kong’s in less than an hour, but this thing has made it through several hours now. Jr. seems to like it and the PB I hid inside, so fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Renedied69

customer_reviews.title: Great for most dogs, just not mine
customer_reviews.text: For most dogs, the black Kong is the top of the line. I've had many dogs over the years and Kong has kept them busy when I needed a break. Unfortunately my current dog is a super chewer and he figured out how to chew up even the tough black Kong the same day I bought it. So for most dogs, I highly recommend this product, unless you have a extra super chewer like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: WOW!  Only thing is 10+ years able to survive my 70lb pit with jaws of steel!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried everything that was said to be "chew proof" only to return a few mins later to the toy or chewie in 23345 pieces. This thing has survived weeks of chewing and licking and to say I am impressed is an understatement. She can usually destroy anything and this, I just fill with peanut butter or ice and she will chew and lick for a decent amount of time. IMPRESSED!
customer_reviews.author: Alex and Elise

customer_reviews.title: Great product but the smell!
customer_reviews.text: These seem more durable and like they will last my 4 dogs awhile if they acruelly play with. However, I am rating this only two stars because the smell in terrible. I've had for three weeks and the smell is as strong as when I unpackaged. I've even washed them by hand a few times. My dogs won't even play with them. I have no clue what the smell is. I would expect them to smell like rubber but it's not rubber it smells chemical.
customer_reviews.author: Janet H.

customer_reviews.title: Literally A Life Saver!
customer_reviews.text: We were having a fit potty training the dog we rescued from the pound. She did not want to go into her crate during the day. It was getting to a point where we were going to have to make tough decisions. Our Vet Tech friend recommended this with some peanut butter in the hole and put her in her crate. So when we are leaving, we put peanut butter in the hole and tell her to go to "her place." She runs to her crate and spends hours trying to get the peanut butter out. It's been weeks since an accident. She has very powerful jaws and it has held up so far. We are very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Durable, tasty, fun
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got a nine month old German Shepherd and he can chew through a lot of stuff but not a Kong. This black Kong is the one that most suits him. He had the red smaller one as a pup but now that can fit in his mouth too easy. This one is bigger and even though he chews hard there aren’t even any teeth marks on it yet. Love this product, it keeps my baby happy when he can’t come with me.
customer_reviews.author: CBrat

customer_reviews.title: XL seems more like a medium, but other than that typical Kong
customer_reviews.text: Kongs do last almost forever, even with a chewer. We have several we fill with bananas and freeze so our lab can have treats when he's left alone. THe only negative on this is doesn't seem as big as it should be. I ordered the XL and that's what the tags said when it came but it's smaller than the other two i have at home. One of which was only a Large.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Strongest Kong there is!
customer_reviews.text: My adult GSD loves this thing and hasn't destroyed it yet! I love stuffing it with treats, frozen foods and pairing with the kong brand spray cheese and peanut butter (rinses out better than regular peanut butter). You can even put it in the dishwasher! While puppy sitting a friend's teething and destructive GSD, it was the only toy she couldn't destroy.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for all dog owners!
customer_reviews.text: My dog chewed through a toy made out of the same material as a 🔥 FIRE HOSE so we needed the best of the best! And this chew toy is a beast! She has chewed on it everyday for a month and we still can’t find a scratch or damage to it. I would recommend for teething puppies, put it in the freezer with a little bit of peanut butter in the bottom. You’ll thank me later!
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Good for Bored Chewers
customer_reviews.text: My 70 pound coonhound can and will destroy anything in sight. I’ve had this for a bit now and I’ve filled it with peanut butter and the Kong cookies and it is still one complete piece with no signs of damage. I’m impressed! I will say that this thing doesn’t have nooks and crannies to hide the peanut butter so even if it’s frozen, he cleans it out in under 10 minutes. The Kong cookies that you shove inside last MUCH longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size up for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: The Large did not work for our Rhodesian mix pup. She is under 1 year old and about 50 lbs. She's NOTHING like the pitbulls I used to have, when it comes to chewing strength, but she ate right through the large in a month. The company sent us an extra large and that worked much better. I remember my pitbulls used the original KONG and it lasted a year or more. These Extreme KONG products must trigger more aggressive chewing OR they are just not as tough as the original product. The Seller has been great, though.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Expensive "toy" recommended by trainer
customer_reviews.text: Expensive "toy" recommended by trainer. My dog NEVER plays with it. And when I put food in it - it is not able to get the food out. The tiny balls that you can insert goldfish crackers into that roll around on the floor and are available in supermarkets are MUCH better and MUCH cheaper. My dog plays with them ALL the time. This is not a "crate soother" or a "toy" or a "food dispenser" for my dog. Failed on all counts. And hit my wallet HARD. Would NOT recommend this to ANY dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: FRANCES

customer_reviews.title: Other toys that have been marketed as super tough have lasted literally only minutes with our little ...
customer_reviews.text: This and other similar Kong products are among the only toys that our six month-old Australian Shepherd has not been able to destroy. He loves his new black Kong as-is, no need to stuff it with anything (though he would definitely not mind if we did) and will play fetch with it for an hour or more if we let him. He also gnaws it (really, "mouths"), which has allowed us to stop buying rawhide bones, which we were not exactly a fan of. This item still looks practically brand new after over a week of heavy, daily play. Other toys that have been marketed as super tough have lasted literally only minutes with our little guy.
customer_reviews.author: ECMWF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My GSD/Border Collie mix is an aggressive chewer. My yard is littered with dead frisbees and tennis balls. Within an hour, a tennis ball is quickly shredded. I bought this toy hoping it would last longer. It has been 24 hours and this toy has already outlived every single toy I've ever bought. If it gives out within the next day or two, I would be very disappointed, but so far it has been a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: VERY durable
customer_reviews.text: My little girl has chewed through everything that has been given to her (even the red Kong!) This black one has held up terrificly! Sturdy and she loves to lay there and knosh on it.
customer_reviews.author: LynnRaeB

customer_reviews.title: Four paws up!
customer_reviews.text: We lost our first Kong ball that we had for two years so this is a replacement for that. Our pooch loves it! He’s a lab mix, tough on frisbees and tennis balls but hasn’t destroyed a Kong ball yet. I like that I can wash it off when it gets dirty, because it will collect all his hair he has shed on the floor! I put a large dog biscuit through the hole or peanut butter and it keeps him busy for a few minutes! I would recommend this for moderate chewers, not sure about destructive dogs but it’s lasted with my doggo and he plays with it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Minyard

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL FOR SIZE OF DOG ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I'm shocked at Kong now. Used to buy these when I had German Shepherds. Figured I'd get 1 for my current dogs which are small, and 1 of which is a super strong chewer. I have 3 small dogs now. 1 dog is 12.5 lbs, 1 is 14 lbs and 1 is 20 lbs, so I got the 1 for "up to 25 lbs." One look at this toy and I'm afraid to give it to the dogs for fear that my 20 lb dog will swallow it whole and choke. If you have a dog anywhere near the max weight suggested on the package, please buy the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Ka

customer_reviews.title: Only thing my dog can't chew into pieces
customer_reviews.text: I have a Staffordshire Bull Terrier, and his mouth is so strong he will destroy most toys in literally seconds. The only two things I can give him to chew and play with is deer antlers and this. He loves it when I put peanut butter inside, keeps him busy for awhile. Also like the fact that it bounces in random directions so its more fun for him and he likes to throw his toys up in the air anyways. Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable enough for really strong dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product would last a bit even after seeing some of the other reviews about how their dogs would chew through this one. Unfortunately my 45lb chew-happy dog broke this one in half not even a week after receiving it. It was good initially but isn't durable enough. If your dog has a really strong bite then I don't recommend this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had product long, but Pit loves it.  At least she didn't destroy it within the first hour!
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this for a 70lb Pit Bull. She absolutely loves it! Kept her occupied for hours with Peanut Butter and a little Kibble mixed inside. The next time tried it frozen. She got the mixture out really fast, then lost interest in it. Will not give it to her without supervision because she can be a strong chewer, but it is holding up quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C.

customer_reviews.title: Get more than one -- you'll want more in the queue
customer_reviews.text: I got four of these and fill them up with plain greek yogurt, peanut butter and kibble at the beginning of the week. I freeze them solid and whip them out when I'm going to be at work and can't bring the pup. There's something very therapeutic about gnawing on a cold, rubber chew and licking out the insides. I'm a lifer with the Kong.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps him from getting board when I'm busy
customer_reviews.text: My Kona Bear is a BIG puppy. (100 lbs) I fill his Kong with dehydrated treats that I make him and a small amount of almond butter. He sits for hours pulling treats from it. He's even learned how to pick it up and drop it to get the treats to fall out. He'll bring it to me when I ask where his almond butter toy is. He cracks me up watching him play with it. Afterwards he's all tired and curls up on the couch for a nap. Great toy!
customer_reviews.author: Holistic Health Coach

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss.. you won't know until you have one. Worth a shot.
customer_reviews.text: Dogs just aren't interested in chewing on them. I think they like something more with more give. Two Weimaranars.. They do like licking peanut butter out of them, but this is not really a good idea to me. Unless you wash them regularly, there is going to be some old peanut butter inside this thing that is going to get nasty. Hard to clean out. I think this is a hit or miss depending on your dog. They havn't put a dent in them, I guess that is a plus. But they don't really chew at them much. Other reviews some dogs love em and can't hurt them...some destroy them pretty quick. Probably worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: The skinny...Top Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Caution!
customer_reviews.text: Read carefully and note that it is not advertised as 'Toxic Free'. I feel I may have done my poor dog a disservice all these years and fear she has been negatively impacted by the black smudge that rubs off after some daily use. She has been ingesting that! NO MORE. Please be aware that there are other food toys that are non-toxic and much better choices. I feel this product is like fancy old tire rubber! The toy is great-the material is not. Your dog and I ask you to search for better, non-toxic materials please.
customer_reviews.author: Dezna's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Large means dog size NOT product size. Too small but very durable
customer_reviews.text: Great for my dog he chews literally everything and destroys it! It doesn’t even have a dent in it and honestly wears out his jaw sometimes. When it says large it means for large dogs! Don’t think it means the product is any larger. Maybe it was just me and I didn’t read the dimensions fully but I figured description was large and the more chew power it had the bigger it would be. Not the case. Love it’s durability just wish it was larger
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 20 minutes!!!
customer_reviews.text: DON'T say it is for extreme chewers when a 45 pound dog can destroy in less than 20 minutes! He bit off the top knob in about 10 minutes and another chunk 10 minutes later. Now it was a choking hazard. If you need a dog to test your products - - so you can HONESTLY claim they are for "extreme chewers," let me know. Because our dog would be an excellent tester. This is probably the tenth item he has destroyed in less than a half hour- - and all were marked for strong chewers. Can I return for a refund????
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Silbernagel

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last two hours with small dog!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that the Kong extreme lasted less the 2 hours before a small pup chewed off a large portion of it. Returned as not satisfied with product performance. We've purchased the black extreme chewer large Kong's for our big dogs and they are still intact. This was very disappointing to see the quality slip so dramatically.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: so happy with this
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find something a young, rambunctious giant won't break through, but so far the Kong hasn't disappointed. My big pupper loves this and I've already ordered another Kong toy for him to play with. It's very strong and durable but not overly hard on his teeth and gums since it's rubber. It fits well in his mouth and survives backyard tumbles and overnight hurricanes. When we bring it inside, it's easy to clean and wash out the dirt. I've yet to fill it with treats, but I actually bought some yesterday so I'll go do that now! Great product, overall. My pup and I are both super satisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: Thalia S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tough chewers!
customer_reviews.text: Our Blue Heeler and German Shepherd puppy were fighting over the one we had so we bought another one. This is the best value I've found for these, they're about $3-$4 more expensive in store and this is the real thing by all I can tell. We put a spoonful of peanut butter in each and those two go to town! Those two are really tough on their tows and so far these have been great!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor R

customer_reviews.title: Best dog toy
customer_reviews.text: Best toy on the market for aggressive chewers. I visited the zoo years back and observed a silverback gorilla chewing on his. These toys are tough and last. If you do not own one, you should. You can fill the inside with wet food, peanut butter, frozen beef broth, whatever. I put wet food in it, then freeze it. Takes my dog longer to get the food out and buys me time to avoid being on the lookout for him eating my carpet.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Love these extra tough black KONGs
customer_reviews.text: Love these extra tough black KONGs. It is very tough but if I let my dog (shepherd mix) chew on it obsessively she will start to chew it up. I fill it with treats and peanut butter and let her go at it. After she's been at it for a while I can hear it making a "squeaky" noise and I know I need to take it away from her. For my dog, the black KONG has the right amount of "chewy give," noise, and get-the-treat-challenge to keep her entertained. I've never been able to find a toy that she hasn't destroyed so I never buy a toy with that expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid from CoHi, DC

customer_reviews.title: Good chewy for your dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a half miniature Pinter & half poodle. He is 3 years old. He loves chewing. He had the red Kong’s he chewed through 2 or 3 after about 4-5 months so I’m trying this one. He still loves chewing it. I put peanut butter inside it. You can wash it in your dishwasher. I’ll have to see how long this one will last for him.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for peanut butter!
customer_reviews.text: These are the absolute best toys I have ever gotten. I put peanut butter in them and either freeze them or just let the dogs go to town with just the room temp peanut butter in them. Keeps them busy forever. As much chewing as they do, this is one toy that they absolutely cannot destroy. Even after the peanut butter is long gone, they still chew and lick these things clean. I got the large size king, but both my chewers are medium size dogs so it is perfect for them.
customer_reviews.author: Woohoo0022

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for both of my pitbulls to stay occupied and they love this toy. I have one for my 10 yr old and she has had hers for 4 yrs and not destroyed itn she mostly just eats peanut butter out of hers. Also recently purchased another xxl for my 10 month old pitbull who is a mega chewer and he stays occupied for long periods of time and has not destroyed his toy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Black Kongs FOR LIFE
customer_reviews.text: We've all had those power chewers that shred everything they touch. BUT NOT THIS KONG! Make sure you get the right size for your dog. If it's too small they are able to chew the tops section off. My big boys love their kongs, we fill them with peanut butter, fruit, yogurt, kibble. Entertains them not only when used to give treats but as a toy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: My Labrador hasn't killed it yet!
customer_reviews.text: *Get XL for your Labrador retriever/similarly sized dog* Pro: THIS is the first toy my newly adopted Labrador retriever (9 month old) hasn't ripped apart yet and I am confident he never will. Con: I wish there were more treats specific to the XL Kong. I have a hard time trying out different types of treats to make it challenging for him to get out. My puppy has a sensitive stomach so I am resistant to try out the spray can treat.
customer_reviews.author: MaybeJackie

customer_reviews.title: some kind of space age material that cannot be eaten
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was just a rubber chew toy but finally got one after my vet gave me a miniature one. My dog can eat any toy in less than an hour. (Rottweiler mix) but he can chew on this Kong all day. I think it is made out of some kind of space age NASA material not from this world. I don't understand how he can chew on it but never leave a mark. My dog though is not such a huge fan and I'm not a fan of putting peanut butter in things to make him frantically lick at it so I'm not really into this toy.
customer_reviews.author: JimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good toy. Size was a bit big for out dog.
customer_reviews.text: Though our dog an chew through almost anything, she wont chew on this lol. We bought this to help her have a toy longer than 5 minutes, shes a German shepherd/boxer mix, but she would rather just lick at the treats from the large hole and not chew on it. Maybe a smaller version would be better for her to force her to chew on it. Idk either way it's a great product
customer_reviews.author: KNova

customer_reviews.title: I have a 100lb great dane mix who quite frankly destroys every toy he ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 100lb great dane mix who quite frankly destroys every toy he gets. This is the only one he hasn't torn to shreds. The only negative about it is that it's kind of hard to clean out. I put peanut butter, some kibble/snack in it and give it to him when we go out so he's not bored. The dog enjoys it a lot :) It's also fun for him to chew even when it's empty. I bought two- one is snack ready in the freezer, and the other one is out for play until it's time for a wash. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Francesca FioreTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for cat, not quite so perfect durability
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 10lb, very food motivated cat. I originally purchased the red one not realizing the colors correspond with durability. He chewed the small bulb off the red one so a friend recommended the black one. Perfect size for him and he loves it. Knocked off a star cause he still managed to chew off the small bulb, though it did take several days longer than the red one. I still use the remaining bit of it as he hasn't managed to chew it in half yet and its been several months of daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Leena Carmenates

customer_reviews.title: Pit bull proof!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a pit who destroys everything instantly and this has held up for the past 4 months. It’s currently misplaced under some piece of furniture but we will find it again. It does have some very noticeable teeth marks in it so far but i see it lasting another 6 months at least which makes it totally worth it since most toys are destroyed in under ten minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: A Tough Chew Toy
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if there was an affordable toy that my 50 lb Tanzanian street dog couldn't chew through. She has destroyed many tough chews in the past. So far, so good with this KONG. She loves the challenge of getting the treat out and has not damaged it yet. Maybe, in the future she will succeed in destroying it (but "so far, so good"). It was worth the buy, it's holding up nicely, and it's great way to keep her entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Kenna Dieffenwierth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for strong chewers!
customer_reviews.text: I'm VERY happy with these. I bought one for each of my three dogs (all strong chewers) and they love them. The best part is that we've had them for several weeks and they are still all in one piece and ripe for the chewing. And, believe me, they chew them all day long. They especially love it when I put some peanut butter (WITHOUT XILITOL) in there for them. Keeps them busy, happy and quiet for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Donnashops

customer_reviews.title: Won't last!
customer_reviews.text: It only lasted until the return window's closed after 3 months. I obviously got it because my dog is a power chewer and already destroyed everything else. This one lasted around 4-5 months. At least it didn't shred into pieces. I wonder if I can send it to the manufacturer (the Kong, not my dog)!
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Not extreme
customer_reviews.text: I have two small dogs, and one medium dog. The medium dog is a super chewer. He destroyed the two small kongs that I had for my other dogs, so I bought all new extreme ones. He easily destroyed this too, the first day we had it, after taking it from one of the small dogs. This is not extreme whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Prncesss001

customer_reviews.title: Proving Great Enrichment Toy @ Our Shelter
customer_reviews.text: We love these Kong's. Our local SPCA volunteers provide them to our tail wagging friends, stuffed with kibble topped of with Peanut butter or Squash and frozen. They provide enrichment relief to kennel bound dogs. They work their brains , provide extra nutrition and amusement all at the same time. These are the most durable of the full line of Kong's. I recommend the XXL Extreme (black) if you have a chewer. They are not indestructible, but they are durable.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for your dog,  will leave them busy for hours
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a great toy for your dog, it stimulates them, as they have to work for their treats. Its design leaves them chasing it around. It's odd shape makes it easier to grab, when you have the stubborn dog, who won't let go for a game of fetch. I'm a repeat buyer, with a very aggressive chewer, they are well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Richie S

customer_reviews.title: Best toy I got for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I never give 5 stars but that might be a good time to give it because my dog loves and kinda opposed with that toy it help with his teeth coming out and annoying him and even without anything in it he loves it. So I can definitely recommend to get your dog will love it. Make sure you get the right size depends on your dog size you don't want him to try eating it. Very strong my dog can bearly scratch it.
customer_reviews.author: yaniv zinger

product_meta.title: KONG - Extreme Dog Toy - Toughest Natural Rubber, Black - Fun to Chew, Chase and Fetch
product_meta.description:
Size:Large| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe KONG Extreme dog toy represents the most durable strength of KONG rubber. Designed for the toughest of chewers, the KONG Extreme offers enrichment and helps satisfy dogs' instinctual needs. The KONG unique, ultra-durable, natural rubber formula is designed for determined chewers, while the erratic bounce fulfills a dog's need to play. Want to extend play time? Be sure to stuff with tempting bits of kibble and entice with a dash of peanut butter. Add to the fun by adding KONG Snacks and top with KONG Easy Treat. Stuff and Freeze for a longer-lasting challenge. Covered by KONG Satisfaction Guarantee. See KONG Satisfaction Guarantee document below for full details.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The KONG Extreme dog toy represents the most durable strength of KONG rubber. Designed for the toughest of chewers, the KONG Extreme offers enrichment and helps satisfy dogs' instinctual needs. The KONG unique, ultra-durable, all-natural rubber formula is designed for determined chewers, while the erratic bounce fulfills a dog's need to play. Want to extend play time? Be sure to stuff with tempting bits of kibble and entice with a dash of peanut butter. Add to the fun by adding KONG Snacks and top with KONG Easy Treat. Stuff and Freeze for a longer-lasting challenge.
feature_bullets: INSTINCTUAL NEEDS: The KONG Extreme black rubber toy helps satisfy dogs' instinctual needs and provides mental stimulation. Healthy play is important for dogs' physical and mental development, emotions and behavior. By encouraging healthy play and satisfying instinctual needs, this toy helps solve chewing, separation anxiety, teething, boredom, weight management, crate training, digging, barking and more!
FETCH TOY: The KONG Extreme's unpredictable bounce makes for exciting games of fetch and other interactive play with your pet.
POWER CHEWING DOGS: The KONG Extreme black rubber formula is created for power chewing dogs.

GREAT FOR STUFFING: The stuffable KONG Extreme is even more enticing when stuffed with kibble, peanut butter, KONG Easy Treat, Snacks or Ziggies. Dishwasher safe for easy clean up. BONUS: For an added challenge, freeze stuffed KONG for 4-6 hours before giving to your dog.
VET RECOMMENDED: Veterinarians and trainers worldwide recommend the KONG Extreme. Made in the USA. Globally Sourced Materials.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
